alert.note: Alert for Kimble; Mason; McCulloch; Menard; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 2:43AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Kimble, southern McCulloch, eastern Menard, Mason and southwestern San Saba Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 243 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Camp San Saba, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brady, Mason, Art, Brady Lake, Loyal Valley, Streeter, Camp Air, Hilda, Calf Creek, Grit, Katemcy, Voca, Pontotoc, Fredonia, Camp San Saba, Hedwigs Hill, Long Mountain, Hext, The Intersection Of Us- 190 And Ranch Road 1311 and Us-377 Near The Kimble- Menard County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Kimble; Mason; McCulloch; Menard; San Saba
